snippet: A makeup artist gathers homeless religious statues in a shuttered Catholic church that he owns, and then restores them to their former ethereal state.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column highlights the work of makeup artist Lou McClung, who gathers discarded religious statues from closed Catholic churches and restores them to their former ethereal state in a shuttered Catholic church that he owns in Lakewood, Ohio.
lead_paragraph: A makeup artist gathers homeless religious statues in a shuttered Catholic church that he owns, and then restores them to their former ethereal state.

headline.print_headline: Religious Statues Left Behind Find Their Own Patron Saint
headline.seo: Religious Statues Left Behind Find Their Own Patron Saint
headline.main: Religious Statues Left Behind Find Their Own Patron Saint
